emuInput.TitMainTitle: Portrait of Mary Drew, wearing striped two piece bathing suit, leaning against ladder of Ammon Recreation Center swimming pool
emuInput.CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, August 3, 1946 reads: "A Bathing Beauty - A perfect example of an honest-to-goodness bathing beauty, Mary Drew, one of Pittsburgh's most able "aqua girls," will be among the participants in colorful Water Circus at Ammon Center pool Friday, Aug. 9. The Circus, directed by Pomeroyal C. Fountain, physical education instructor of the Centre Avenue YMCA, will be one of the feature events of Frogs Week Celebration.  Lovelies from all over Western Pennsylvania will vie for top honors in the bathing beauty contest.  The winner will be awarded a $50 was bond, and other cash prizes will be given to those sharing honors.  The spectacular show will include all types of stunts, ballet dancing and thrilling diving.  The Bureau of Recreation is joining with the Frogs in sponsoring the Circus which promises to be as sensational as anything of its kind ever presented here.  According to the committee in charge of the event a large crowd is expected. - Harris Photo."
